I like the poles over a cane because they help my posture, reducing back pain, and the pressure of my weight isn't all on one hand as I tend to do with a cane. Also, I have to justify the money I spent on trekking poles. And they help with dogs.

Wonderful! The trekking poles are really helping me, although they do slow me down a tad. Without them, I'd be at 3.1 mph. I'm walking about 2.7 mph using the poles. My danger area without them is when I turn my head to check traffic and lose balance. Whee 81! But, I'm still here, a plus.
All done! Glad I had my waxed coat today - a bit cold, windy, and rainy out the entire time. Also, trekking poles highly recommend for this trail.

Everyone is saying trekking poles are legitimately very good and can make hiking a lot better if you're worried about your knees (i am) (tall) but. They make you look like such a dork..

Trekking poles got me to actually speed when doing some moderate to difficult trails. The increased speed got me sure footed enough that after a few yrs of increased mileage I've started to trail run again. Now on longer trails I'll still use poles but I'm trying to go out running twice monthly.
A lot of trekking poles get broken scrambling on boulders when they get trapped in holes covered by leaves. A lot of hips, knees, etc. don’t fair much better.

I walked about 3.7 miles at a 3.3 mph pace. The trekking poles are really helping me and I am not having much back pain. I have finished Pimsleur Spanish course one since I did lessons 28, 29, and 30 enroute to Tulsa and back yesterday. I am on course two and I did lessons 1 and 2 tonight.

Really happy with my new design for hiking with Molly. Double bungee cord and fix to my harness with a carabiner. I can’t trip over the lead now. Roll on the Lake District next week when I’ll be hiking with trekking poles. 😁😁😁

I went for a long walk, 3+ miles and used my trekking poles. I'm growing to like them as I get used to them. It's reducing, to eliminating, the back pain I frequently experienced. I did 3 lessons in Spanish, 26, 27, and 28 of course 1 on my walk, and then did lesson 5 of Russian 1 after I came in.
I second walking sticks! I have knee problems so my trekking poles go with me on every adventure!
